course.title: Openings: The Illuminated Manuscript
course.meeting_text: M., W., at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.faculty_text: Jeffrey F. Hamburger (History of Art and Architecture)
course.description: In an age of mechanical - and now virtual - reproduction, we have lost sight of the basic visual unit that structures our experience of the book: the opening. Employing old and new technologies, this course focuses on medieval books, their decoration and their readers in the Middle Ages (ca. 300-1500), when the book as we have known it, along with allied institutions, such as the university itself, first came into being.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
